page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The rectangle is in the Blackmore Vale,which is in Dorset. It is on a ridge of limestone in a clay vale varying from 50 to 100 m in height. The River Stour flows through Sturminster Newton in a southerly direction.The part that passes through the area we covered is 20 metres wide. Sturminster Newton is 10 miles from Blandford,12 miles from Sherborne, 20 miles from Dorchester and 10 miles from Shaftesbury. In 1962 a railway was closed and some of the tracks remain. The population of Sturminster Newton in 1981 was 2284.Hinton St. Mary to the north has 182 people. This area has many services,including social work,primary secondary and special schools, and old peoples homes. It is a very rural area with small fields,mostly grassland. { }
